換.definition: to exchange; to change (clothes etc); to substitute; to switch; to convert (currency)

換乘.definition: to change train (plane, bus etc); transfer between modes of transport

換人.definition: to replace sb (personnel, sports team player etc); substitution

換代.definition: to transition to a new dynasty or regime; to replace an older product with an upgraded, new-generation one

換位.definition: to swap places; (logic) conversion; (car maintenance) to rotate (tires)

換位思考.definition: to put oneself in sb else’s shoes

換個兒.definition: to change places; to swap places

換取.definition: to obtain (sth) in exchange; to exchange (sth) for (sth else)

換屆.definition: to change personnel upon expiry of a term of office

換崗.definition: to relieve a sentry; to change the guard

換帖.definition: to exchange cards containing personal details (when taking an oath of fraternity)

換成.definition: to exchange (sth) for (sth else); to replace with; to convert into

換新.definition: to replace with sth new; to upgrade

換毛.definition: to molt (of birds); to change feathers

換氣.definition: to take a breath (in swimming); to ventilate

換湯不換藥.definition: different broth but the same old medicine (idiom); a change in name only; a change in form but not in substance

換牙.definition: to grow replacement teeth (zoology); to grow permanent teeth in place of milk teeth

換班.definition: to change shift; the next work shift; to relieve (a workman on the previous shift); to take over the job

換算.definition: to convert; conversion; (in accounting, referring to currency conversion) translation

換置.definition: to swap; to exchange; to transpose; to replace

換證.definition: to renew a certificate (ID card etc); to leave an ID at the desk to gain entrance

換防.definition: to relieve a garrison; to change guard complement
